statsBulletinHeadline.headline1: The Consumer Prices Index (CPI) grew by 1.9% in the year to June 2014, up from 1.5% in May.
statsBulletinHeadline.headline2: The largest contributions to the rise in the rate came from the clothing, food & non-alcoholic drinks and air transport sectors.
statsBulletinHeadline.headline3: CPIH grew by 1.8% in the year to June 2014, up from 1.4% in May. RPIJ grew by 2.0%, up from 1.7% in May.
statsBulletinHeadline.title: Consumer Price Inflation, June 2014
statsBulletinHeadline.summary: CPI, CPIH, RPI and RPIJ inflation price indices for June 2014 - brief description and analysis

title: Inflation and price indices
summary: Inflation measures the rate of increase in prices for goods and services using price indices. The rate of inflation used in the UK governmentâ€™s inflation target is measured using the Consumer Prices Index (CPI). One way to understand the CPI is to think of a very large shopping basket containing a large selection of the goods and services bought by households, the CPI estimates changes to the total cost of this basket.

breadcrumb.title: Home
breadcrumb.summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

breadcrumb.title: Economy
breadcrumb.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.
